---
title: "presentation_figs"
---

```{r}

# Load necessary library
library(ggplot2)

# Generate a sequence of hours from 7 to 20
hours <- 7:20

# Assuming peak activity at 3 PM, calculate activity levels using a normal distribution
mean_hour <- 12 # 3 PM
std_deviation <- 2 # Standard deviation to adjust the spread
activity <- dnorm(x = hours, mean = mean_hour, sd = std_deviation)

# Create a data frame for plotting
activity_data <- data.frame(Hour = hours, Activity = activity)

# Plotting the activity curve
ggplot(activity_data, aes(x = Hour, y = Activity)) +
  geom_line() + # Adds a line graph
  geom_point() + # Adds points to the line graph
  scale_x_continuous(breaks = hours, labels = formatC(hours, width = 2, format = "d", flag = "0")) +
  labs(x = "Hour of the Day (24-hour format)", y = "Activity Level", title = "Activity Over the Day") +
  theme_minimal()
```
